Job Title: Customer Support Engineer - 1 year fixed term
Job Description:
About RM

RM is the leading supplier of technology and resources to the education sector, supporting schools, teachers and pupils across the globe - from pre-school to higher education – including examination boards, central governments and other professional institutions.

We’re on the lookout for an onsite Customer Support Engineer to join our team based from our London school site.

What we can offer you;

£24,100 - £32,000 depending on experience
25 Days Annual Leave (with an option to buy an extra 5 days)
Performance related bonus scheme (if applicable)

What’s the purpose of this role?

The Customer Support Engineer provides support to Managed Service customers. Our Managed Service customers includes establishments at all levels of education from Primary and Secondary schools through to Colleges and Learning Centres. This role covers a broad range of technologies including all on-premise, cloud wireless networking solutions and all technologies required to deliver teaching and learning.

Customer Support Engineers need a strong customer focus, with a proactive approach to service delivery. The role’s main focus is to ensure that all support incidents are managed and progressed to resolution. This is to be done whilst ensuring customers are regularly updated of progress and that incidents are resolved in line with their service level agreement deadlines.

What does the job entail?

The duties of are wide ranging, but ultimately involves;

Day to Day Service Delivery
Proactive Maintenance
Change Implementation
Process Improvement

What are we looking for?

As the right candidate for the role will have some of the following:

Strong diagnostic skills
Customer focused - to deliver an excellence service at all times.
Broad technical knowledge - experience and technical understanding of on-premise, cloud and wireless technologies.
Team working - working effectively with team members to achieve collective objectives.
Planning and organising - efficient use of time and systems to achieve service level agreements and within customer expectations.
Influencing and communication - to understand the customer requirements and to set correct expectations. The ability to actively listen and communicate clearly both verbally and in writing is essential.
Tenacity and self-motivation - the ability to work well under pressure and complete issues from start through to completion. Takes ownership of personal technical development.

What’s in it for you?

Our competitive core benefits package includes 25 Days Annual Leave (with an option to buy an extra 5 days), a Performance Related Bonus Scheme, membership of our Group Personal Pension with higher contribution levels available from the Company if you choose to contribute more, Private Medical Healthcare, and enhanced family leave.

We also offer voluntary benefits such as Cycle to Work Scheme, Family Private Medical Healthcare, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Critical Illness Cover, Health Assessments (cost deducted over 12 months), Give as You Earn and an Employee Referral Scheme.

At RM we are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive and flexible workplace where all our colleagues can be themselves and succeed on merit.

More Information

RM is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and expects all permanent and temporary staff to share this commitment. This role is exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 and all successful candidates will be subject to Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) checks along with other relevant employment checks.

Job Reference: E01992

Anaplan, the Connected Planning pioneer, is changing the way the world's most respected companies do business. We believe in clear, open communication enabling teams to overcome obstacles and move forward together. We want you to feel that you belong to a team, you matter, and are able to be your authentic self. We all work together to deliver business value with the power of Connected Planning at every level within every organization, and alongside an ever-growing number of users, a rich partner ecosystem, and active community. At Anaplan, our values are key to everything we do. We call it #AnaplanLOVE

At Anaplan these words come to life by making employees feel empowered and inspired.

Building a strong culture around company values is an ongoing journey

that will continue to be the core of our existence.

At Anaplan, we are looking for a self-motivatedINFRASTRUCTURE ENGINEER to join our growing team of global engineers at our vibrant tech hub inKings Cross London, UK to build and ship award-winning, cloud planning technology that is helping people and companies around the world every day to make better-informed plans and decisions.

You will join a team of individuals who embrace and respect diverse perspectives, aren't afraid to push boundaries and try new ideas, and are passionate about helping our customers and each other succeed. We work hard, but we also don't wait for an excuse to have fun. In fact, we're so serious about it that it's one of our core values.

Anaplan are currently a remote workforce in light of COVID-19 and will be till spring / early summer when we will get to return to our awesome offices.

As a Infrastructure Engineer we know that you're passionate about building Infrastructure as code. You delight in building tools to automate away routine tasks and you're constantly seeking new ways to improve performance.

What you'll be doing:
Designing, implementing, and supporting critical shared services that our platform depends on
Automating deployment and management in both public cloud and private date centre environments
Working with virtual machines, containers, and Kubernetes
Providing the tooling to enable consumers to self-serve their requirements
Ensuring compliance with security and regulatory requirements
Required Experience:
Configuration management using Chef and Ansible
Infrastructure management using Terraform
Container technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm
Automation and deployment tooling, such as Jenkins and Rundeck
Scripting in Python
Middleware components like HAProxy, Nginx, and Apache
Metrics, monitoring, and logging (we use Splunk and SignalFX)
Linux administration
Strong fundamental infrastructure knowledge, such as FNS, persistence technologies, and networking
You will be part of the UK Infrastructure engineering operations. You'll be working closely with the Engineering Development, Product Architecture, and Program Management teams. You'll be part of the partnership between our UK and US Infrastructure teams.
Our diversity and inclusion commitment

Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!

Our story

Anaplan is a cloud-native enterprise SaaS company helping global enterprises orchestrate business performance. Our customers come first to create heroes, unlock potential & build trust and confidence. We challenge legacy thinking and software that isn't flexible for the modern organization. We have architected the only platform that will take the time from planning to decision down to zero.

We're building a truly unique technology. From our calculation engine and in-memory data store, to apps and predictive analytics; amazing technology is being developed every day.

We're addressing a $100B/year problem that all global businesses face. Our mission is to break the traditional business planning mold, currently performed through spreadsheets or legacy systems.
Anaplan's Connected Planning platform is enabling customers to improve decision-making by turning response time into real time, to make better decisions to enhance your business. The platform helps you dynamically orchestrate performance enterprise-wide, and convert constant change to your environment.

See what our global customers and partners have to say about Anaplan's platform is solving some of the most complex challenges in business. CEOs, analysts, and the press agreeAnaplan is changing the way the world does business. Learn about our history, see our recognitions and achievements, and take a look at what it's like to work at Anaplan. Get to know more about working at Anaplan by checking out our social channels.

Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube

Can't find the perfect role for you? New opportunities are opening up daily: http://anaplan.com/CAREERS

COVID-19 Update

Protecting the health and safety of our communities, including our employees and of those considering a career at Anaplan, is our highest priority. We continue to closely monitor the evolving situation and we appreciate your understanding and flexibility with any related changes to our interviewing process.

Company Description

Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career

As our authority in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud (GCP, and other public cloud environments. You are the “go to” resource for customer interactions that exceed standard Systems Engineering support requirements (we always expect a baseline expertise in all areas from our SE’s but augment them with SME in the advanced or new technology areas.

The Public Cloud Systems Engineering role is a technical role that directly supports sales delivery of quota. You will be measured by your expertise and your ability to lead to customer successes. There is also a requirement for close interaction with Product Management teams, Consulting Engineering teams to ensure that we continue to out-innovate our competition.

Your Impact
Present to customers at all levels in the hierarchy from engineering team members to CIO the solution, benefits, usp’s, etc.
Lead conversations about industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape to prepare for customer planning
Discuss, with credibility, competitive offers in the marketplace and position ours as the best alternative
Lead and support customer demonstrations that showcase our unique value
Interact locally and remotely with customers in an equally persuasive manner
Help customers adopt Palo Alto Networks cloud offerings
Be the technical voice of Sales for all things related to security and compliance in Public Cloud (Alicloud, AWS, Azure, and GCP)
Be an evangelist to further bring Security, DevOps, and SecOps together (DevSecOps)
Provide technical demos to prospective customers
Write code/scripts as needed or be able to learn if you don’t
Run Proof-of-Value (POVs) to ensure the customers’ requirements are exceeded
Work with Product Management, Consulting Engineering, Technical Marketing, and R&D to build requirements and product features for our large customers and provide feedback from customers
Provide design consultation and standard methodology mentorship for rollout, implementation, and policy conversion during the pre-sales process for strategic opportunities
Take ownership of advanced proof of concept (PoC) testing in strategic accounts
Provide demos for strategic prospects and current accounts in all facets of Palo Alto Networks virtual offerings and integration in existing data center environments
Assist in the training of new Palo Alto Networks SEs in their designated region in installs, customer presentations, and internally-focused deal preparation activities
Provide advanced 'Partner SE' training for updates in the Palo Alto Networks product suite
Help develop relationships with new Born-in-Cloud (BiC) partners who will be critical to win over new top tier customers
Support relationship expansion with top existing partners for Public Cloud
Qualifications

Your Experience
8+ years of experience as a system engineer, solutions architect, or systems integrator
Working knowledge of AWS and/or Microsoft Azure, GCP, other cloud providers, and cloud security models, firewalls, and other security technologies both from a technology and a business driver standpoint
Demonstrable experience in securing cloud environments and cloud systems, including topics around certification and compliance
Experience in DevOps will be an added advantage
Programming experience in a higher-level language such as NodeJS, Ruby, Chef, Puppet, YAML, JSON or Python will be advantageous
Good understanding and expertise of tools such as Ansible, Terraform, CI/CD (Jenkins, GitHub, etc.)
Deep understanding of API based security & compliance standards
Good understanding of Unix/Linux and Windows operating systems and scripting
Demonstrable experience with AWS and/or Microsoft Azure or GCP installation, configuration, and administration of security features and services
Experience with cloud networking models and connectivity, network security, virtualization, and cloud computing
Experience working with customers, positioning, demonstrating, configuring, and fixing network infrastructure security products
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong problem finding and solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution, even under duress
Worked with Channel partners and understand a channel centric go to market approach
Experience from companies in the enterprise networking security space
Experience understanding exploits, malware, ransomware, and etc.: their creation and activation
Additional Information

The Team

As part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our systems engineering team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.

Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

AWTG, the world leader in 5G application development, is looking for Senior Network Engineer and System Administrator to join its Innovations and Engineering Division based in London. We are looking for a goal oriented and driven network engineers with relevant experiences in System Administration, Network Security and IT Infrastructure design and management. We offer a very competitive salary and benefit packages.

Job Description:
Network Engineer to design, implement and maintain corporate networks, communications systems and data centre technologies.

Subject matter expert in IP networks, IT infrastructure, Network Security and System Integration.
Design and implement full IT networks
Manage and administer IT systems
Maintain and review operational and maintenance technical documentation.
Design, develop, test, deploy, monitor and troubleshoot.
Network health checks using available end-to-end monitoring tools for AWTG corporate networks.
Provide system integration and IP connectivity to 4G and 5G deployments of the company.
Support the teams to identify their IT infrastructure project requirements and solutions.
Define and implement projects to standardize and improve our existing network and infrastructure as well as our clients.
Produce high-level solution designs and work with third parties to secure accurate quotes for hardware, software and professional services. This will involve liaising with the Vendors and work with them for best outcome for solutions.
Co-ordinate and plan data center hardware changes, including servers, storage and virtualization technologies both internally and for our clients.
Review and approve operational, infrastructural change requests for both internal and our clients.
Define data and IT security systems within the company and for any client that requires it.
Delivery of solutions for our client’s platforms, systems and infrastructure using your strong background in networking and cloud computing.

Excellent computer skills
Good Attention to detail
Effective Planning and organizing
Effective Communication skills at all levels
Problem-solving skills
Capable of designing and using Cisco, Extreme, Juniper, Brocade, Ruckus, Ericsson, and Nokia equipment
Knowledge of virtualization, virtual containers, NFV and SDN
Capable of undertaking 5G connectivity and infrastructure design

A World-Changing Company

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

In your role as a Staff Engineer, you will plan, design, develop, deploy, and operate infrastructure services in the cloud. You will assume technical ownership of entire projects, applications, and services and help shape the future of our cloud infrastructure services and development processes. You care deeply about technical and architectural excellence and will partner with stakeholders across the company to develop infrastructure that fits both the problems at hand and aligns with long-term visions and roadmaps.
Requirements
Assume end-to-end ownership of entire projects, applications and services; from design to development, deployment, and operations.
Promote high standards in terms of adherence to best practices. Lead by example in relation to code consistency, performance, robustness, scalability, intuitive APIs and libraries, all of which are core tenets for our solutions.
Stay abreast of state of the art technology and engineering developments. Steer towards good tool and technology choices that both fit the problem at hand and long-term visions.
Help shape and promote sound engineering practices and software development processes, within and across teams, in an agile, iterative, fail-fast environment.
Coach and mentor; perform peer code reviews and engineering reviews as well as share and promote learnings across the organization (e.g. through internal talks, blogs, etc.)
Partner with product owners to develop a deep understanding of stakeholder’s business problems, and translate to architectural and technical decisions.
Level up our platform including enhancing our test coverage, observability, alerting, and performance.
What We Value
Extensive experience designing, building and operating cloud infrastructure and scalable distributed systems, and a strong track record of working directly with AWS, Azure and Puppet.
Experience as a technical leader with proven success in fast-paced, agile software engineering teams.
Desire to solve complex problems in an iterative fashion, delivering frequent tactical wins while making progress towards long-term strategic goals.
Comfort with owning and implementing solutions all the way from initial business problem through concept and vision, design, architecture, iterative development and delivery.
Strong coding skills (Go is required, Java is preferred).
Experience working on large scale, distributed infrastructure systems.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com.

Job Title: Cyber Security Software Engineer - Tech For Good
Job Description:
_*Are you an experienced cyber security software engineer with a desire to make green & sustainable practices the norm?*_

A London-based company specialising in large-scale renewable energy storage solutions have an opportunity for an experienced cyber security software engineer to join their growing team.

They want to hire someone with a proven background in cyber security who approaches software challenges with a curious & positive mentality; the kind of thinking they feel is critical to bring about a much needed change to the energy sector.

A small company themselves, they are partnered with some of the biggest global energy firms in their journey to bring about a more efficient & cost-effective means to supply green energy to the planet.

Their wider software team use:
Go / Golang
AWS as their chosen cloud service for infrastructure
Docker
NoSQL Databases (Cassandra & MongoDB)
CI / CD
If you’re experienced with the above, fantastic. Otherwise, they’re looking for applicants with any of the following traits:
Proven experience implementing best in class security practices
Experience working within IoT
3 – 5 years of Java / C++ / Python experience – they need someone with exposure to a strong scripting language.
The confidence to be an authority in cybersecurity when it comes to software builds.
Cloud native exposure.
Knowledge of building microservice architectures.
An ability to develop automated software.
Why Do People Join Typically Join This Company?
Working within the low-carbon energy space, the entire company are committed to bringing about an essential change to the world we live in.
They build complex systems from scratch, meaning the technical challenges remain interesting day to day for software engineers in particular.
They have built a culture around two tenets - personal development & having fun.
Remote & Flexible Working:

This company are currently working remotely in line with government guidelines; in the future, they hope to return to working out of their offices whilst retaining a healthy approach to those who prefer to work from home.

If you’d like to know some more details about the company, including what kind of benefits, flexibility & working culture they offer, please apply & I’ll be in touch to discuss!

Description:

They will have 3+ years' experience working in a customer facing service desk environment, ideally within an outsourced/managed service organisation. Providing Business As Usual (BAU) support to many different clients, ensuring high uptime, quick resolution of incidents, and great customer satisfaction
Analysing, troubleshooting, and resolving operating system, system hardware, application, storage, virtualization and networking issues
Use tools to manage operating system updates, patches and configuration changes
Performing data backup and restore requests
Performing software and hardware upgrades
Providing status reporting and improvement recommendations
Adhering to change control policies and procedures
Liaising with vendors, suppliers and professional services. Coordinating hardware maintenance and repairs with vendors

About us:

Virtuoso is an award-winning IT managed services provider headquartered in South Quay, London. We implement and manage business platforms and applications for our customers across the UK. They choose us as their integrated technology partner to help them harness the intelligent Microsoft Cloud. We offer a range of managed and professional services which focus on matching customer requirements to innovative technologies, delivering truly positive business outcomes.

Are you a technical expert in all things SSO? Know your Okta from your OneLogin? Are you patient and persistent (even patient enough to show your Gran how to use her Sky+ remote... over and over)? If so, please keep reading....
About you*
You’ve got a background in SaaS and are familiar with the types of IT challenges modern businesses face. Forget Oracle and massive ERPs, you’re up to date on the latest innovations in SSO and identity management. You’ve got a fresh pair of eyes and can spot ways to improve how our clients are working from 50 paces. Clients trust you: you can speak to them about technology in ways they can understand.

What kinds of tech should you know about? Well, one person can’t know everything, and we wouldn’t expect you to. But if you were familiar with one or more of the following, then that would be great:
Okta
OneLogin
BetterCloud
To apply, we ask that you have:
Experience in implementation cloud software
Experience with identity management within an organisation
Ideally, you have:
Experience implementing OneLogin or another SSO platform
Good understanding of Box or other document management systems
Knowledge of cloud IT infrastructure
And you should be:
Energetic, enthusiastic and has a strong drive to help build a start-up
Passionate about information security and moving the world toward cloud-based working
Approachable with strong presentation skills
Ability to problem-solve, think outside the box and notice things that most do not
About the Role*
Our technical consultant will be responsible for demonstrating and implementing the products and tools sold by our sales team. You will need to confidently and carefully take our customers through the installation of their new SaaS tool and ensure they understand how to make the most out of it from day one. In short, this would include:
Becoming an expert in the cloud tools we sell
Assisting sales with customised product demos to prospective clients
Presenting to stakeholders and decision-makers
Answering Q&As from both technical and non-technical stakeholders, gently persuading them to the right course of action
Project management and implementation of SaaS tools for clients
Training end-users
Embracing our core value to be the most trustworthy and knowledgeable supplier on the market
Reporting directly to company director
What’s in it for you?*
Well, the honest answer is... it depends. There are options for business growth related bonuses, the salary is negotiable and for the right person, there are some great long-term benefits. We’d rather discuss it at interview.

You’ll be joining a rapidly growing start-up, so it’s a great opportunity to be in at the beginning and grow with us. Right now, you’ll be working remotely, but you’ll need to be able to get to Borehamwood for ad-hoc meetings with the leadership team (David and Rob).
About Us*
Remitech specialises in getting businesses set-up for effective, secure remote working. We make sure our clients acquire the right software, at the best price, and help them get the most out of their new tools from day one.

We’re an experienced, dedicated team of problem-solvers who are only ever a phone call away. We’re consultant-led, which means when you get us on the line we talk like humans, not robots, and focus on finding the best solution for your business.

We’ve already built a strong client roster including some of the UK’s most disruptive and eye-catching start-ups like Starling Bank, Curve and PensionBee.

Job Title: AppDynamics Customer Success Engineer- UKI & Nordics
Job Description:
About us
AppDynamics is an application performance monitoring solution that uses machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) to provide real-time visibility and insight into IT environments. With our unique AIOps solution, you can take the right action at exactly the right time with automated anomaly detection, rapid root-cause analysis, and a unified view of your entire application ecosystem, including private and public clouds. Using AppDynamics, you’ll finally align IT, DevOps, and the business around the information that helps you protect your bottom line and deliver flawless customer experiences.
Our inclusive culture promotes a creative, innovative, and collaborative environment that helps drive our globalization strategy.
About the Role
As a Customer Success Engineer, you will deliver world class post-sales technical leadership to our client base working directly with customers as dedicated specialist on Application Performance Management as a practice and AppDynamics.
You will be delivering value by driving adoption of our App iQ platform across the client’s infrastructure.
Finally, you will have the opportunity to work directly with our Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to share your knowledge and experiences to ultimately improve our business and our customers’ success.
About You 10+ years technical IT experience in a strategic, decision making capacity. 5+ years’ experience deploying Enterprise Software Solutions. Good understanding and experience of common web application architecture frameworks, distribution mechanisms and messaging components based on Java and .NET Experience and competence working with Unix, Linux and Windows operating systems including shell scripting Excellent communication, written and presentation skills Passionate about programming Ability to work with multiple clients concurrently Readiness to travel up to 50%
Key responsibilities (What do you do?) Actively drive value realisation of AppDynamics Software Increase operational use of AppDynamics across customer environments Mentor AppDynamics practices Identify training gaps and opportunities for expansion and enhancement Drive a Strong Enablement Program
Desirable Skills: Customer-facing experiences such as a pre-sales or consultancy or experience in APM Understanding of the application performance management space or hands-on experience on AppDynamics is a bonus Working knowledge of storage area networks and virtualization technologies Knowledge of AWS, Azure and/or other cloud technologies Knowledge of basic networking components and concepts Experience with web servers and common relational databases used in today’s application architectures and an ability to understand SQL. Proficiency in Danish or Swedish language is preferred
Education:
· Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar, or equivalent technical experience
What we're offering:
We are focused on personal development. That is why we sponsor Udemy classes, instructor-led training, certifications, etc. anything which helps maximize the potential of our team members. Moreover, we offer competitive pay as well as great benefits package that includes private health care, participation in Cisco Employee Stock Purchase Program, generous time-off policy and much more.

Company Overview

Third Bridge was founded on the belief that human insights drive intelligent investment decisions.

To make the right investment decisions, our clients require access to the most relevant experts and their insights we enable this through private consultations and exclusive content drawn from expert interviews.

Our clients consist of some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds, mutual funds and management consulting firms, who are serviced by a team of over 900 employees located across eight global offices.

Third Bridge operates in a global, multi-billion-dollar market with double digit annual growth and has consistently received accolades for Great Places to Work and the top 100 fastest growing companies.

Technology Function Overview

Our Tech function has considerably scaled in the last 2 years. We have invested heavily in our infrastructure and technology capability, enabling us to deliver innovative solutions and deep insight market intelligence to our clients. Through harnessing the latest tools and technology, we allow the business to work faster, more intelligently and we are uncovering more and more business opportunities as a result. We are also continuing to build a word class product team which will help take Third Bridge to the next level, and beyond. We are fully hosted in AWS and embracing all the latest trends in well-architected applications.

Our Tech stack is varied and not limited to: NodeJS, Java, Go, PHP and Python. We use Docker containers and Serverless technologies for all new applications and have a large EC2 estate running our older tech stack. Our test automation environment is based on a Java stack. Our planning and delivery processes are Agile and loosely based on a blend of Scrum and Kanban.

We aim to hire talented, creative and versatile people that help us grow and make our technology better and faster. We promote language and framework agnostic approach, best practices in architecture and design, devops culture, autonomous and empowered teams, in a collaborative environment.

Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
As a Devops Engineer, youll be an essential part of the team that will help teams deliver value to the Business in the fastest possible way while meeting quality standards and guaranteeing the security and reliability of all the systems involved.
Essential Skills:
Excellent communication skills in English
Solid experience working with Agile Methodologies and supporting delivery teams
Proven experience supporting production workloads in a cloud environment (preferably AWS)
Solid experience in with fully automated CI/CD pipelines (preferably experience with tools outside the Jenkins ecosystem)
Solid experience with IaC tools (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Experience with scripting languages (preferably Python)
Can elaborate on past examples when you have demonstrated an attitude of collaboration and shared ownership of responsibilities with Software and Quality Assurance engineers
Passion for learning and continuously developing both soft and technical skills
Experience with containers or very good understanding of benefits and best practices
Experience with serverless applications or very good understanding of benefits and best practices
Positive attitude towards shadowing, mentoring and pair-programing
Why work for us?
Flexible working
Private Medical Insurance - up to family cover
Pension
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, rising after 2 years of service
Free yoga sessions - twice weekly
Free Sanctus sessions (we care about your mental and physical well being)
Personal annual learning and development budget
The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.

We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

The Site Reliability Engineer is a senior technical resource with experience across both software development (50%) and infrastructure engineering (50%) domains. The role supports 24x7 delivery of Hosted and SaaS applications to global Fortune 500 clients at cloud scale. It requires 2 or more years of career experience managing systems in a 24x7 production environment.

The successful candidate will be able to ensure agreement and transparency between business expectations and team commitments. This requires interfacing with both internal and external customers to understand and document requirements and design and deliver solutions. This is a client-facing role that requires a commitment to customer service and process excellence. Prior experience in organizations leveraging both agile software development and ITIL service management methodologies is required.

Trintech is the leading global provider of financial software solutions for the Record-to-Report process. Supporting 1,700 clients from 8 data centers worldwide, Trintech clients include many of the world’s largest firms (Walmart, Intel, Microsoft, Siemens, majority of Fortune 100).
Evolve continuous integration\continuous deployment (CI\CD) toolsets and methodologies to maintain consistent environments and automate deployments.
Design, code, and test automation and tools in accordance with best practices and coding standards.
Identify dependencies and risks, proposing solutions that optimize trade-offs between time, cost, and scope.
Fully support 24x7 production environments with cloud-scale Hosted and SaaS applications.
Mentor members of own team across domains.
Lead shift in a follow-the-sun rotation providing 24x7 production support.
Maintain subject matter expertise across multiple domains and applications.
Effectively support applications throughout all lifecycle stages, interacting with multiple stakeholder groups in multiple environments (e.g., QA, UAT, and production).
Lead efforts to improve efficiency, employing methodologies and technologies as needed.
Champion efficiency, automation, and best practices with own team.
Make significant contributions to process and documentation initiatives.
Recognize common mistakes being made and takes action to prevent recurrence.
Own root cause analysis for complex infrastructure and application issues.
Identify and drive strategies to prevent recurrence.
Ensure production changes are documented, fully tested in non-production environments, and adhere to change control and audit requirements.
Demonstrates insatiable passion for learning and technology.
Is self-motivated and driven to succeed collaboratively, caring more about solution than credit.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
2 or more years of experience managing systems in a 24x7 production environment.
Demonstrated ability and proclivity for programming/scripting languages (e.g., Java, C#, .NET, PowerShell, Python).
Hands-on Windows system engineering skills.
Network engineering and/or security experience. Exposure to firewalls, load balancers, routers, switches, etc. (e.g., Cisco, F5, etc.).
Experience supporting virtualization technologies such as VMWare vSphere or Microsoft Hyper-V
Experience supporting a range of web (IIS, Apache, Tomcat), database (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.), and reporting (Intellicus, SQL Reporting Services, etc.) technologies.
Experience using enterprise ticketing systems and tools (Salesforce, Remedy, JIRA, TFS).
Exposure to with Docker and related technologies (e.g., Mesos/Marathon, etc.) is a plus.
One or more relevant technical certifications (e.g., Microsoft MCSE, RedHat RHCE, Cisco CCNA, CISSP, etc.) are desired.
ITIL v3 Foundation certification is a plus.
Agile Certified Professional (ACP) certification is a plus.

Expedia

What you’ll do:

We are looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our teams, responsible for developing technology that helps millions of travellers to find the best hotel at the right time for their next unforgettable trip.
Working in an agile team and look for ways to continuously improve through asking and providing feedback.
You will act as a point of contact for technical issues for specific work streams within a project.
You will implement product features working as part of a multi-functional team using agile methodologies and run what you build approach
You will drive ongoing improvements in application architecture to help build and design highly scalable enterprise applications
Who you are:

We don’t believe in skill matching against a list of buzzwords…

We look for smart people with good general programming skills because we believe that exceptional developers can learn new technologies quickly and well. However, it wouldn't hurt if you have experience with some of the following (or a passion to learn them):
Fluent Object-Oriented Programming concepts, data structure, algorithms, preferably in Java.
Very passionate about learning, especially in the areas of technology, service design patterns and system architecture.
Be self-motivated with drive and good organisational skills to work to challenging deadlines.
Critical thinker, expected to speak out and defend views.
Experience delivering and supporting highly available and scalable solutions with large transaction volume.
Experience of using cloud services (e.g. AWS)
As a team, we love to…
Expand our skills in building highly scalable solutions while influencing others and raising the bar on the overall level of excellence within the team.
Work in an environment where elegant, clean, maintainable code is favoured over messy hacks.
Share our knowledge with each other and learn new things.
Take advantage of our amazing travel discounts and tick some destinations off our bucket lists!
We’ll take your career on a journey that’s flexible and right for you, whilst recognising and rewarding your achievements…
Competitive salaries and many growth opportunities within the company.
You will get the opportunity to serve as a domain expert in multi-functional feature delivery.
Option to attend conferences globally and enrich the technology skills you are passionate about.
A conversation with your Manager around flexible working and what is right for you is encouraged from day one.
We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is the most awesome workforce…

We believe in being Different. We seek new ideas, different ways of thinking, diverse backgrounds and approaches because averages can lie and sameness is dangerous.

Expedia is committed to crafting an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

Why join us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.

Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground, so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.

Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, VRBO®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.

Anaplan, the Connected Planning pioneer, is changing the way the world's most respected companies do business. We believe in clear, open communication enabling teams to overcome obstacles and move forward together. We want you to feel that you belong to a team, you matter, and are able to be your authentic self. We all work together to deliver business value with the power of Connected Planning at every level within every organization, and alongside an ever-growing number of users, a rich partner ecosystem, and active community. At Anaplan, our values are key to everything we do. We call it #AnaplanLOVE

At Anaplan these words come to life by making employees feel empowered and inspired.

Building a strong culture around company values is an ongoing journey

that will continue to be the core of our existence.

You will join a new team of talented infrastructure engineers, bringing technical leadership to the team. You will be building and automating the quality infrastructure that our business relies upon daily. The team acts as autonomous owners of its own roadmap, tools and processes. Few engineering teams get the satisfaction of working as closely with their customers: many of your customers will be other engineers at Anaplan.

You will join a team of individuals who embrace and respect diverse perspectives, aren't afraid to push boundaries and try new ideas, and are passionate about helping our customers and each other succeed. We work hard, but we also don't wait for an excuse to have fun. In fact, we're so serious about it that it's one of our core values.

What you'll be doing:
Providing technical leadership to a team of experienced engineers
Championing industry best practice in cloud infrastructure
Coaching and mentoring teammates ranging from junior to senior
Communicating and liaising with and influencing other technical and project leaders
Contributing significantly towards transitioning to a containerised microservice architecture across multiple public and private clouds
Building robust infrastructure for platform and application components using infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines
Investigating and evaluating new technologies that will improve or benefit our platform
Building tools to enable others to self-provision infrastructure on demand
Coaching members of other teams in using the platforms we build
More about you:

You have a wealth of experience in using public cloud technologies and applying these technologies to address real world problems. Designing cloud infrastructure with an eye on meeting availability, durability, security and regulatory requirements will come naturally to you.

You have strong knowledge and understanding of best practices when it comes to operating in the public cloud and be able to coach team members in the application of these practices to all that you do.

You have a passion for automating everything from spinning up VPCs in cloud providers, to safely taking code from commit to production multiple times a day, and champion testing of all you do. You thrive in an environment that values collaboration, feedback, and learning.

You learn well and can bring yourself up to speed with complex systems; you enjoy collaborating with developers and embrace the value in continuous improvement.

You have a pragmatic approach to incremental improvement, advocating for achievable goals that deliver value rather than aiming for perfection in the first iteration.

Our core platform stack includes public cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure), running Kubernetes with Docker which hosts our JVM based applications but we're looking for exceptional engineers regardless of your stack of choice - really smart, passionate people who believe in simplicity, agility and performance and can choose and use the best tools for the job.

Technologies you'll work with:
Kubernetes, Docker
Terraform
AWS, GCP, Azure
Go and Java
Jenkins and Harness
Vault
Bonus points:
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
Experience working with containers and container-orchestration tools across multiple cloud providers whilst maintaining consistency
Continuous Delivery in a SaaS environment
Our diversity and inclusion commitment

Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!

Anaplan is a cloud-native enterprise SaaS company helping global enterprises orchestrate business performance. Our customers come first to create heroes, unlock potential & build trust and confidence. We challenge legacy thinking and software that isn't flexible for the modern organization. We have architected the only platform that will take the time from planning to decision down to zero.

We're building a truly unique technology. From our calculation engine and in-memory data store, to apps and predictive analytics; amazing technology is being developed every day.

We're addressing a $100B/year problem that all global businesses face. Our mission is to break the traditional business planning mold, currently performed through spreadsheets or legacy systems.
Anaplan's Connected Planning platform is enabling customers to improve decision-making by turning response time into real time, to make better decisions to enhance your business. The platform helps you dynamically orchestrate performance enterprise-wide, and convert constant change to your environment.

Company Description

Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career

As our Systems Engineer Manager for Prisma Cloud, you are the technical leader for your District Prisma Cloud Systems Engineering team. This SE organization comprises go-to technical experts who are instrumental in helping our customers architect, scope and realize their cloud security transformation.

You will work closely with the District Sales Manager for Prisma Cloud and, along with your team, build relationships with your customers with the goal of helping them securely deploy applications, containerized and serverless workloads securely across any of the major Public Cloud Service Providers and in some instances their own Private Cloud infrastructure. Your guidance, expertise, and mentorship of your team of SEs will keep them ahead of the latest cyberthreats and staying on the leading edge of prevention and vulnerability detection.

We are looking for a leader to develop our pre-sales teams, providing training and technical support as a product expert. Additionally you will provide feedback to the product management team on new feature requests and product improvements based on what you learn from your customer base. Your team, in partnership with the technical sales managers, will displace competitor technologies, and build market share within your targeted list, and most importantly, help your client sleep at night as they use our products to secure their public cloud infrastructure and workloads.

Your Impact
Recruit and hire new systems engineers into the territory, hiring the best talent in the industry
Retain, train, mentor, and review employees on your team, while keeping them engaged and successful in their careers
Reinforce the technical excellence, hands-on scrappy, and customer first culture. Help preserve our dynamic “start-up” energy as we scale
Must be able to maintain a positive outlook, while leading and keeping the SEs motivated in a fast paced and ever changing environment
Help define and continuously update the system engineering training curriculum
Lead and support the field systems engineer team in complex evaluations, problem solving and challenging customer environments
Act as a floating system engineer and fill in for existing team members if there is a resource conflict, or vacation coverage challenge
Act as an escalation point for pre-sales and post sales technical issues that arise
Provide effective technical leadership in customer interactions to include sharing security trends and standard methodologies employed by other customers to actively be part of the selling process
Build and maintain relationships with key customers to solidify reference accounts and to assist the account teams with defining plans to drive more business
Present to customers as our expert in your area at all levels in the customer hierarchy from engineer to CISO
Steer conversations about industry trends and emerging changes on the security landscape that every customer needs to plan for
Discuss competitor products in the marketplace and positions ours as the best alternative
Champion the voice of our users and customers to influence product direction and feature priorities
Provide design consultation and standard methodology mentorship for rollout, implementation, and policy conversion during the 'pre-sales' process for strategic opportunities
Ownership of advanced 'proof of value' testing in strategic accounts
Maintain a general understanding of competitor selling strategies and product capabilities
Maintain a positive outlook, while leading and keeping the SEs motivated in a fast paced and ever changing environment
Qualifications
2+ Years’ experience as a pre-sales System Engineer Manager
6+ years as a Senior System Engineer or Consulting Engineering
Industry knowledge of security product market trends and directional awareness of our roadmap and technology development efforts, knowledge of competitor offerings and products
Domain expertise in the areas of public cloud architectures, cloud native security models, CI/CD, DevOps, firewalls, and other security technologies both from a technology and a business driver standpoint
Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
Quota driven attitude focused on client's best solution by being a trusted advisor
Additional Information

The Team

Palo Alto Networks has brought technology to market that is reshaping the cybersecurity threat and protection landscape. Our ability to protect digital transactions is limited only by our ability to establish relationships with our potential customers and help them understand how our products can protect their environments. This is where our systems engineer (SE) teams come in. Our SE team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations to keep their digital information safe. Our passionate systems engineering teams educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients.

As part of our systems engineering team, you help support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our systems engineer team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.

Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. To learn more about our dedication to inclusion and innovation, visit our Life at Palo Alto Networks page and our diversity website.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Additionally, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

This role will include a healthy mix of project, design, and support work, for both internal & client initiatives. Citrix Cloud

Experience in deploying and managing Microsoft Exchange (2010 and up) in a highly available deployment across multiple sites.
Experience with hardware and software load balancing technologies. Experience with Netscaler is beneficial.

Sound experience working with networking technologies to gather information for networking team.

TransferWise is one the fastest growing companies in Europe and we're on a mission: to make money without borders the new normal. We've got 8 million customers across the globe and we're growing. Fast.

Current banking systems don't let us send, spend or receive money across borders easily. Or quickly. Or cheaply.

So, we're building a new one.

And, we're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Security Product team in London, who is responsible for the global security features of the TransferWise products.

For our customers, using TransferWise should feel as simple as sending a text message. Yet behind our app and website lies a complex, one-of-a-kind engine of currencies and routes that's being designed, built and powered by our talented teams in cities around the world. With new capabilities being built every day, there's still a lot to figure out, and we can't do it alone. This role is a unique opportunity to have an impact on TransferWise's mission, grow as a product leader and help save millions more people money.

The Security Product team is responsible for user authentication, security settings management, account recovery and more. Without these services being robust and resilient to failure, it means customers cannot even access TransferWise's products. We want to deliver sustainable solutions for product teams, with a healthy dose of paranoia knowing how complex, distributed systems can fail.

Here's how you'll be contributing to the Engineering Team
You will be working hands-on as an SRE, but embedded with the Security Product team responsible for the authentication and authorization of our customers. It means making tradeoffs when it comes to convenience and security, as well as availability and consistency of this crucial access layer.
We expect knowledge of OAuth2, user and potentially, service-to-service security, especially how it scales in a reliable manner. Security Product is not the only team that has implemented the Authn+Authz domains, but important to collaborate and be able to take an architectural view of these approaches and services. This means monitoring, observability and testing are fundamental when it comes to talking problems and solutions.
Is that you?
Strong experience in Java, Spring Boot/Framework/configuration, especially in designing and implementing libraries and frameworks
Experience with authentication/authorization domains and frameworks, e.g. OAuth2.0, SAML
Knowledge of security best practices and working on vulnerabilities with a bug bounty program
Experience with microservices, Docker containerisation and Kubernetes
Basic sysadmin skills in debugging issues with disk, network, app/JVM performance etc
Will not settle at all for downtime and outages, do not want to be woken up in the middle of the night
Nice to Have
Good knowledge of relational (RDBMS) and NoSQL databases
Experience with building out scalable and automated Cloud platforms on preferably AWS
Knowledge and an eye on newer architectural concepts such as microservices, service mesh, observability
Have clear understanding of the test pyramid, including end-to-end functional and/or load tests at scale
Experience with advanced release and change management processes
Key Areas of the role;
Define and create standard operating procedures that are compliant and auditable
Ownership of mission-critical shared infrastructure - run, maintain and schedule upgrades
Isolation of environments and work with various engineering teams to figure out how to best suit their needs
Sees failover and DR events as something that needs to happen with regularity and should be seamless
Engage regularly with our blameless postmortem culture, always focused on continuous improvement
Interested? Find out more:

How we work – a practical guide

TransferWise Vlogs: Omar, Engineering Lead

Engineering team blog

Scaling our Infrastructure; how we make it work

We're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you're passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you'll fit right in.

Also, qualifications aren't that important to us. If you've got great experience, and you're great at articulating your thinking, we'd like to hear from you.

And because we believe that diverse teams build better products, we'd especially love to hear from you if you're from an under-represented demographic.

To enable this the SRE will help deliver infrastructure and security improvements to Evaluates infrastructure and supporting processes to establish a foundation built on best practises.

Data & AI platform team is seeking a highly driven, hardworking and talented Software Development Engineer II to build machine learning platforms and AI solutions that support the entire Expedia Group. We’re on the leading edge combining the advances in machine learning and cloud infrastructure to deliver AI capabilities at cloud scale. We focus on AI for travel data intelligence R&D, build a high-performance AI platform, and deliver high impact AI solutions. We work very closely together with our brands/BUs across Expedia Group.

What you’ll do
Design, develop and maintain core platform features, services and engines
Partner with data scientists and other engineers to help invent, implement, and connect sophisticated algorithms to our cloud-based engines and drive cutting-edge research into product realization
Solve complex business problems by utilizing disciplined development methodology, producing scalable, flexible, efficient and supportable solutions using appropriate technologies.
Work with other engineers and research teams to investigate design approaches, and evaluate technical feasibility
Develop new technology prototypes to help with future exploration
Who you are:
3+ years of relevant, professional experience in a fast-paced, high-transactional engineering environment

Experience in Java, C++, Python, Scala or other equivalent languages
Experience with Object-Oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem-solving and complexity analysis. Academic and/or industry experience with advanced AI and ML techniques preferred
Experience in defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility trade-offs preferred
Experience in developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance, and reliability (K8s, YARN) preferred. Experience with Spark, Hive & Flink is a plus
Experience in building and driving the production of innovative end-to-end Machine Learning platforms will be a plus
Why Join Us:

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. You will be involved in highly innovative projects which seek to boost internet connectivity across the world.

Ansible

About Evaluate Ltd

Evaluate provides trusted commercial intelligence for the pharmaceutical and medical device industries.

Our core online subscription service, EvaluatePharma® delivers a seamless view of the past, present and future of the global pharmaceutical market in a single, standardised platform. EvaluatePharma Vision® builds on this to provide the first ever single view of the risk and return of the R&D landscape. Evaluate Vantage – our award-winning, independent editorial team – provide thought-provoking news and insights into the current and future developments in the industry. Evaluate has been a trusted partner to industry-leading organisations for over 20 years. For more information on how we give our clients the time and understanding to drive better decisions, visit www.evaluate.com.

Evaluate is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to support a programme of SDLC modernisation and to establish DevOps practices in the business. The SRE will facilitate the transition of a variety of build & deployment processes into a robust, full-automated CI/CD pipeline for C# and NodeJS applications, targeting AWS. To enable this the SRE will help deliver infrastructure and security improvements to Evaluates infrastructure and supporting processes to establish a foundation built on best practises.

This role would suit someone from a traditional infrastructure background currently in their first cloud centric role or has experience of AWS, IaC and is looking to take the next step.You will bridging both new and old worlds in the infrastructure world with the latter needing modernisation and hardening.

Responsibilities:
Establish robust and well documented CI/CD pipelines for business applications, infrastructure and configuration code
Key objectives of;
Zero downtime and always-successful releases of full stack deployments
Immutable and reversible deployment patterns
Measurable improvements in code quality & security
Manual access to environments or intervention not required
Consistent and robust dev, test and production environments
Develop automation to enable environments to be spun up & down as needed
Establish operational monitoring & logging processes and respond to service outages
Continually improving the existing back office infrastructure and overall security posture of Evaluate in the cloud and on premise.
Working Conditions:

Based in the London office with flexible working. Occasional travel to other offices, subsidiaries & partner locations. Initially 100% working from home while government travel restrictions remain in place due to Covid-19.

Requirements

Required Skills & Qualifications:
Prior experience in a similar role
IaC tools like CloudFormation or Terraform
Git, SVN
Building/configuring Web Servers, APIs, Proxies, Caching and CDNs
Monitoring solutions, such as CloudWatch, Prometheus and Raygun
AWS RDS SQL, MS SQL Server
Computer Science degree, or similar
Secrets management, e.g. AWS Secrets Manager
Server operating systems both Windows and linux
Anyone of the folllowing Puppet, Chef, Ansible
JIRA and Confluence, or similar
Full stack analysis and troubleshooting
Colloboration with peers of different disciplines to deliver business outcomes
Good understanding on network technology and design principles
Active Directory and Azure AD
Excellent network skills. You have to be able to understand how it all hangs together, what talks to what and how
Operational skills. We don't want it just built, you need to be able to think about how and who will support it and everything that entails to ensure stability of Evaluate's services to it's customers
Beneficial Skills & Experience:
Code Analysis tools such as Veracode, SonarQube or Checkmarx
Creation of .Net,NodeJS and IaC CI/CD pipelines
TDD and DI frameworks
.Net and NodeJS web applications, SOAs, lambdas
Centralised logging & visualisation systems such as Splunk, Loggly, Graylog or ELK stack
Package managers, such as NuGet, ProGet and npm
CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Jenkins, Octopus Deploy
AWS account architecture and administration with Control Tower, KMS and Secrets Manager
Route 53, API Gateway, ELB, CloudFront and WAF services (AWS native or Cloudflare)
Elasticsearch
Containers & orchestration (Docker, K8S, ECS, EKS)
AWS CodeCommit, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, CodePipeline
Power BI
Testing tools like Selenium, Chaos Monkey
Understanding of Agile principles
Operational disciplines and understanding non-functional requirements
Experience delivering cloud solutions in a regulated environment
Experience of any one of the following PCI, SOX, HIPPA, NIST, ISO27001
Personal Attributes:

In addition to buying into Evaluate’s values as per below candidates should display the following attributes:
Detailed, structured, methodical and thorough
Open, honest, friendly and approachable
Independent, sense of drive and ability to get things done
Innovative and problem-solving approach
Ability to grow and adapt as business does and achieve success through teamwork
Values Statement

Focus on the client

Our clients’ success is our success.

We do our utmost to understand our clients and ensure they are successful in their roles.

Improve

Be better.

We strive to improve and innovate, challenging industry norms and ourselves.

Be one team

Communicate, collaborate, challenge.

We believe that two heads are always better than one; in being generous with our time, and collaborating to get the job done

Empower

Enable Success.

We empower each other to deliver, celebrate our successes and learn from our mistakes.

Be Accountable

Own it.

We take responsibility and do the right thing. Through guidance and support we hold each other accountable.

Experience in developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance, and reliability (K8s, YARN) preferred. Experience with Spark, Hive & Flink is a plus
